Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about we settle on 2 coins per bushel? That's a fair price, considering the quality of the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          Current time: 1895-09-15 00:10:00.

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and adventurous entrepreneur.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and adventurous entrepreneur.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and adventurous entrepreneur.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 5 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [14 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 15 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone for a basket of apples. Della has offered 5 coins for the basket.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Lennon Figtree?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and adventurous entrepreneur.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Lennon Figtree in right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this, knowing that Lennon Figtree wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree would try to find a price that is fair to both them and Della Plumstone.

          Question: Would Lennon Figtree accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but five coins a kilogram is a bit steep, even for your fine peaches.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about we settle on 2 coins per bushel? That's a fair price, considering the quality of the fruit.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?

However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Della Plumstone attempted to buy apples from Lennon Figtree but they couldn't agree on a price; she is now trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.

Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit because she has a history of trying to buy fruit from him and she can sell the fruit for a profit.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Della Plumstone's options has the highest likelihood of causing Della Plumstone to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Della Plumstone thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit because she has a history of trying to buy fruit from him and she can sell the fruit for a profit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about we settle on 2 coins per bushel? That's a fair price, considering the quality of the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but five coins a kilogram is a bit steep, even for your fine peaches.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about we settle on 2 coins per bushel? That's a fair price, considering the quality of the fruit.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant who is known for his strong will and sharp negotiating skills.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about we settle on 2 coins per bushel? That's a fair price, considering the quality of the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone for a basket of apples.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 3 coins
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 3 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • 3 coins
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a savvy businesswoman who travels to Fruitville to buy fruit at low prices and resell them for a profit. She recently attempted to purchase goods from Lennon Figtree but the deal fell through, and she is now negotiating with Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Which options are available to Della Plumstone right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the apples.

          Question: Of the options available to Della Plumstone, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Della Plumstone to take right now?
          Answer: Della Plumstone's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 4 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 5 coins
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (e)

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is a savvy businesswoman who travels to Fruitville to buy fruit at low prices and resell them for a profit.           Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a businesswoman who buys fruit in Fruitville to resell for a profit. She recently had a deal with Lennon Figtree fall through and is now working with Cedric Meadowbrook. The current time is 16 September 1895, between 10:00 and 10:15.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is a businesswoman who buys fruit in Fruitville to resell for a profit. She recently had a deal with Lennon Figtree fall through and is now working with Cedric Meadowbrook. The current time is 16 September 1895, between 10:00 and 10:15.

        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she helped her mother set up their stall at the market. A young boy, no older than she was, tried to steal a peach. Della caught him, but instead of scolding him, she offered him a piece of fruit in exchange for helping them unload the wagon.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she successfully negotiated a deal with a farmer for a wagonload of pears. Her mother praised her, but Della felt a hollow sense of accomplishment. It was a good deal, but she couldn't shake the feeling that she was simply following in her mother's footsteps, destined to repeat her life.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2

      Joint action

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 4 coins

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 16 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Observation: [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins

          Summary of recent observations: [15 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 16 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is currently negotiating a price of 3 coins for a basket of apples with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Scene 10 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but five coins a kilogram is a bit steep, even for your fine peaches.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about we settle on 2 coins per bushel? That's a fair price, considering the quality of the fruit.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and the other party.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both him and Lennon Figtree.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both him and Lennon Figtree.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose -0.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: What kind of person is {agent_name}?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.

          Question: What kind of situation is {agent_name} in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a business negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and the other party.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both him and Lennon Figtree.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both him and Lennon Figtree.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose -0.0 coins from the deal.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 3 coins
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and Della Plumstone.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Cedric Meadowbrook?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 17 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.

He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is a determined and ambitious merchant.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Cedric Meadowbrook in right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is currently in a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Cedric Meadowbrook do in a situation like this, knowing that Cedric Meadowbrook wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook would try to find a price that is fair to both himself and the other party.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Cedric Meadowbrook likely to say next? Respond in the format `Cedric Meadowbrook -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.

        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • [16 Sep 1895 20:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          ['[17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is selling fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "They look ripe and juicy, Cedric.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "They look ripe and juicy, Cedric.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Lennon, you know I always pay a fair price, but five coins a kilogram is a bit steep, even for your fine peaches.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, I know your fruit is good, but I need to make a profit too.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "I understand, Della. How about we settle on 2 coins per bushel? That's a fair price, considering the quality of the fruit.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon. A fine crop this year, wouldn't you say? I'm asking a fair price for them, considering their quality.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, I'll give you 4 coins for a basket of your finest apples.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
      Della Plumstone -- "Cedric, what's your best price on a basket of those apples?
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Well now, Della, these apples are the finest in Fruitville, plump and juicy. I can let you have them for 3 coin, a real bargain.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "They look ripe and juicy, Cedric.
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "They look ripe and juicy, Cedric.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this, knowing that Lennon Figtree wants to fully cooperate with [] always?

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is attempting to purchase apples at a discounted price from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville's market square with the intention of reselling them for a profit in her hometown.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is attempting to purchase apples at a discounted price from Cedric Meadowbrook in Fruitville's market square with the intention of reselling them for a profit in her hometown.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they bought a crate of bruised peaches at a bargain price, convinced they could sell them for a profit. The peaches rotted before they could find buyers, leaving Lennon with a hefty loss and a valuable lesson about the perishable nature of their trade.

          Answer: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for their fruit while still being fair to Della Plumstone.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook in the Fruitville market square. They are haggling over the price of apples, which Lennon plans to resell in her hometown for a profit.
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Now, Lennon, these are fine apples, the best in the market.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Scene 11 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree proposed 4 coins
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: 4 coins
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • 4 coins
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this, knowing that Lennon Figtree wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Lennon Figtree do in a situation like this, knowing that Lennon Figtree wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree would try to find a price that is fair to both them and Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Lennon Figtree stands to make profit of 5.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and adventurous entrepreneur.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to find a price that is fair to both them and Cedric Meadowbrook.

Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Lennon Figtree is a shrewd and adventurous entrepreneur.

          [15 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is currently at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a discounted price to resell for a profit.
          Query
        • Lennon Figtree, Lennon Figtree is currently at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook at a discounted price to resell for a profit.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Lennon Figtree to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they bought a crate of bruised peaches at a bargain price, convinced they could sell them for a profit. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          Answer: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know these are the finest peaches in all of Fruitville. Surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Lennon Figtree would try to get the best possible price for their fruit while still being fair to Della Plumstone.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these are some fine-looking apples you have here.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, these are the finest apples in the market, surely they're worth a bit more than that.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy apples from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price, with Lennon hoping to resell the fruit for a profit back home.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
